report_title: Industry Landscape for Estate Lawyers and Attorneys
executive_summary: Despite the increased federal estate tax exemption, a growing elderly population and the popularity of elder law have all helped drive demand for industry services. As a result, the numbers of industry establishments, employees and total wage expenditure have climbed during the five-year period. Over the five years to 2026, the industry is expected to continue growing in line with the overall economy and the aging population.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Increased business formation has driven an expansion in employment
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Increased business formation has driven an expansion in employment, which has also increased an estimated annualized 1.0% to 637,166 workers in 2021.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Number of industry establishments has increased
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The number of industry establishments has increased an estimated annualized 1.0% to 211,476 locations during the five years to 2021 as companies have expanded operations.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: IBISWorld forecasts industry revenue to increase at an annualized rate of 2.4% to $18.0 billion in 2026.
IBISWorld projects that industry enterprises will increase an annualized 1.5% to 222,137 operators in 2026.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Wage expenditure and profit margins to increase
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Total wage expenditure is forecast to expand at an annualized rate of 2.0% during the period to $6.5 billion. Profit is anticipated to increase slightly, accounting for an estimated 22.1% of industry revenue in 2026.

industry_definition: This industry comprises legal practitioners (i.e. lawyers or attorneys) that specialize in providing estate, probate, inheritance and trust law services.
key_trends: Industry revenue has grown due to changing demographics and tax laws
Elder law, which overlaps with estate law, is rising in popularity and demand
Expansion in the number of high-earning households has supported industry demand
Industry demand is expected to remain steady as the country's seniors age
Higher disposable income will drive more individuals to pursue estate planning
Many operators are incorporating elder law in response to high demand

market_segmentation.segment_description: This segment only includes individuals aged 18 to 35 because individuals under the age of 18 typically do not engage the services provided by industry operators. Individuals in this segment use estate lawyers and attorneys for a variety of reasons.
This segment represents the largest market for industry operators. Individuals in this age bracket demand industry services on their own behalf and on behalf of others.

Individuals aged 60 and older are now expected to represent the smallest market segment. Individuals in this age group typically hire estate lawyers to plan for the end of life, including creating or amending their wills and making sure their estate and any trusts they have are in order.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Will and Estate Planning and Drafting
products_and_services.product_description: Operators in the industry specialize in estate planning and assist clients in drafting and implementing legal documents, including wills and trusts. Estate lawyers and attorneys also offer services in arbitrating estate, will and trust contests and settling distributive disputes between beneficiaries.

A power of attorney is a written authorization to represent or act on another's behalf in specified or all legal and financial matters. There are four different types of power of attorney, including limited, general, durable and springing.

There are many other services that industry operators provide in addition to wills, estates and power of attorney cases. For example, there are a variety of different trusts that operators assist with, including simple trusts, grantor trusts, split-interest trusts and qualified funeral trusts. Other services include business succession planning, settlement of tax controversies and disputes over family wealth.

tier_1_buyers: Office Supply Stores in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Demand is driven by a variety of demographic factors, such as the age and overall wealth of the US population. These trends affect the potential client base for industry operators.

Many individuals like to ensure that their family and others will be provided for and everything is clearly outlined so there is no disagreement and basis for contestation afterward. Most individuals engage estate planning services for their own estates when they are middle-aged and at their peak earning years.
Changes in tax regulation can also affect demand for industry services. When regulation changes, individuals demand knowledgeable professionals to make sure that they are still acting in compliance.

international_trade_points.trade_description: The Estate Lawyers and Attorneys industry is a services industry, so it does not engage in international trade.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region contains the highest concentration of industry establishments, at an estimated 27.2% in 2021, which is in line with its share of the population at 25.8%.

Following the Southeast, the West has the second-highest establishment count, at 18.0% of the nation's total, and the second-highest population concentration at 17.2%. The high regional concentration is primarily due to the presence of California, which accounts for 13.0% of industry establishments in 2021.
The Mid-Atlantic region accounts for an estimated 16.5% of industry establishments.
The Great Lakes region accounts for an estimated 11.9% of industry establishments.

regulations_points.regulation_title: Law degree and bar exam required
regulations_points.regulation_description: To practice law in the industry, an individual must receive a law degree from an accredited law school and pass the bar exam in the state where the individual wishes to practice.

Typically, individuals wishing to practice estate law choose to specialize in their second or third year of law school and take classes such as asset management, family law, estate law, taxation, real estate law and trusts.
An estate law attorney must also be trained in the Uniform Probate Code, which imposes rules and limits to wills and trusts.
Industry operators are regulated by the American Bar Association (ABA) in their state, besides California, which uses the State Bar of California's Rules of Professional Responsibility.

barriers_points.barrier_description: While law school is expensive, once in the industry, the start-up costs for new entrants are typically low. Estate lawyers and attorneys can cut down on their rent and utility costs through space sharing arrangements.

While barriers to entry are not high, barriers to success are extremely high. New entrants will have difficulty competing in specific markets and building a referral network in an industry with many established players.

Furthermore, a firm's reputation is the most important factor in gaining new clients and keeping existing clients, and the only way to build a reputation is to develop relationships with clients, which can take years.

factors_increased_barrier: low to steady industry assistance level

basis_points.basis_title: Firms compete on quality, reputation and success
basis_points.basis_description: Firms in the Estate Lawyers and Attorneys industry compete primarily on the basis of quality, reputation and success. Since the industry is highly competitive, operators set themselves apart based on their reputation, which is influenced by favorable outcomes for their clients.
Since many referrals come via word-of-mouth reference, it is integral that estate lawyers and attorneys establish positive relationships among their current clients to gain new ones.

basis_points.basis_title: Investment in reputation and brand awareness
basis_points.basis_description: Therefore, industry operators typically invest considerable resources into reputation and brand awareness, such as hiring top estate lawyers and attorneys from reputable law schools.

Additionally, operators typically compete on the basis of price. Estate lawyers and attorneys bill clients based on an hourly rate; however, fixed rates, premiums and capped rates for repeat clients or on big transactions are all common practices.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The Estate Lawyers and Attorneys industry is highly fragmented, with the majority of operators being small firms or branches of larger firms.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Top 4 firms account for less than 5% of revenue
concentration_points.concentration_description: The top four industry operators are anticipated to account for less than 5.0% of industry revenue in 2021, which is indicative of how little concentration there is in the industry.
Furthermore, nonemployers are anticipated to account for 61.0% of total industry establishments and generate an estimated 7.0% of total industry revenue.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wage costs are high and amount to the largest expense
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages for this industry are high and amount to the largest expense for operators. In 2021, wage costs are estimated to account for 37.0% of industry revenue.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchases are a minor cost component
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases are estimated to account for 2.0% of total revenue and do not constitute a significant cost component for industry operators.
Depreciation is estimated to account for 0.7% of industry revenue in 2021. The industry is capital-light and does not make many depreciable investments.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Marketing costs are typical for the sector
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Marketing costs are estimated to account for 2.3% of total revenue in 2021. While industry operators do invest in marketing, they do not invest in marketing at a particularly high rate.
Rent constitutes the third-largest expense for industry operators. Most lawyers operate out of a leased office space.
Utility costs are estimated to account for 0.2% of total industry revenue in 2021.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Other costs include taxes, insurance, malpractice, bad debt
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: All other services are estimated to account for 28.6% of industry revenue in 2021. Such costs include taxes, insurance, malpractice costs, bad debt expenses and other administrative expenses.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The Estate Lawyers and Attorneys industry is characterized by a low level of capital intensity. In 2021, for every $1.00 spent on wages, an estimated $0.02 is spent on depreciable capital investments.
This is typical for industries in this sector, which provides services that are highly dependent on skilled labor and not on heavy equipment or machinery.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Capital expenditures include software and computer systems
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Capital expenditures the industry does undertake include investments in software and computer systems.

volatility_points.volatility_description: The Estate Lawyers and Attorneys industry has been characterized by a moderate level of industry revenue volatility over the five years to 2021.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Demand depends on number of seniors and deaths
volatility_points.volatility_description: Industry demand tends to be dependent on the number of seniors and the number of deaths, both drivers that do not change significantly year-to-year.
The COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic led to a notable increase in downstream demand in 2020 as more individuals felt the need to plan their estates.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The majority of technological advancement that has occurred relates to the internal systems and processes of firms rather than changes to the services provided.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Core services not affected by technology
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The core client-facing services of estate lawyers and attorneys have not been affected by technological change.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Online legal resources pose some threat
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Despite little technological change, operators in this legal industry are more vulnerable to online legal resources since some of the services provided, such as will drafting, can be provided by alternate sources.

FAQs.question: Does your company offer a broad range of services or specialize in a particular niche?
FAQs.answer: Some industry operators may specialize in estate tax planning; others have diversified their services to provide elder law, which includes all legal issues affecting seniors or those with disabilities. Over the five years to 2026, elder law is expected to be an increasingly important source of industry revenue.

FAQs.question: How have economic changes influenced consumer demand for your services?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators tend to experience higher demand during periods of economic growth. Since estate planning is something people already tend to put off, they are more likely to do so during periods of lower disposable income or unemployment. However, amid the coronavirus pandemic, and despite the recession in 2020, industry revenue increased due to an increase in the number of deaths and greater demand for industry services.

FAQs.question: What is your company's most significant operational expense?
FAQs.answer: For most operators in this industry, wage costs tend to be the largest expense. However, for nonemployers who do not hire employees, it may be rental costs. Amid the coronavirus pandemic, operators have had to transition to remote provision of estate planning and administration services, and they have therefore incurred some costs related to videoconferencing equipment and software.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored any alternative operational strategies, such as value based billing?
FAQs.answer: Value-based billing, in which clients are billed based on the value provided and not hourly, has become more popular in the law industry. However, there is still reluctance among many industry operators, which has prevented widespread adoption. Value-based billing is anticipated to increase for the industry in the future, however.

FAQs.question: Has investment in new technologies increased your company's competitiveness?
FAQs.answer: Legal billing software ensures efficient and accurate billing. As billing practices have shifted, and value based billing becomes more common, billing software will evolve to incorporate this. Amid the coronavirus pandemic, remote provision of industry services has allowed operations to continue, especially with older clients.

FAQs.question: Has the implementation of new technology altered or disrupted your company's service offerings?
FAQs.answer: The increasing popularity of online legal advice surrounding estate planning has increased the amount of external competition for industry operators, particularly due to the increased estate tax exemption. Moreover, the increased popularity of online will-drafting services has usurped some document preparation revenue from the industry.

FAQs.question: What are the toughest regulatory requirements that your company experiences?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators face regulation from the American Bar Association (ABA), which licenses industry operators. In addition, estate attorney's must abide by the rules set for wills and trusts by the Uniform Probate Code. Amid the coronavirus pandemic, social distancing protocols have led operators to offer their services remotely, especially to older clients.

FAQs.question: Do you work with industry associations or other groups to advance your company's interests?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators may benefit directly (as members) or indirectly from the work of several organizations, including the American Bar Association (ABA) and the American Association of Trusts, Estates and Elder Law Attorneys (AATEELA). Moreover, the Law Firms industry (IBISWorld report 54111), which is the parent of the Estate Lawyers and Attorneys industry, took out $5.3 billion in forgivable loans through the Paycheck Protection Program in 2020, benefiting the industry.

FAQs.question: How does your company's profit margin compare with those of your main competitors?
FAQs.answer: The industry average profit margin is estimated to be 22.3% in 2021. This likely varies between nonemployers and employing firms, in addition to varying geographically.

FAQs.question: How has your company's profitability trended over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: The industry average profit has trended slightly downwards during the period, but has remained quite high. Due to increased demand amid the coronavirus pandemic, industry profit has remained high.

FAQs.question: How do you select the attorneys that work for your firm? What specific credentials do you seek in your hires?
FAQs.answer: The industry is very competitive, and sometimes disputes between family members concerning estate distribution can be combative. As a result, having a qualified and professional staff is a matter of high importance.

FAQs.question: How have you built and leveraged your reputation to gain new business? Do clients refer you to their associates?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators primarily gain new contracts by having a good reputation, as they deal with highly sensitive matters and therefore clients are selective in choosing what firm they want to work with for estate law purposes. The primary way operators build a reputation is by having previous successful cases under their belt.

FAQs.question: What factors determine the success of your firm in various cases?
FAQs.answer: Multiple factors can affect the success of industry operators, including the quality of their staff, their professionalism in dealing with clients, their attention to the complex details of estate planning and administration and having a high level of expertise in estate law.

FAQs.question: How many of your customers have a high level of income? How can you cater to low-income markets?
FAQs.answer: The industry derives the majority of its revenue from wealthy customers that have high incomes, as their estates are larger and fees for planning and administering their estates are higher. In the wake of the coronavirus pandemic, the number of wealthy households is anticipated to increase in line with overall economic growth, benefiting the industry.

FAQs.question: Per capita disposable income
FAQs.answer: Rising per capita disposable income increases demand for industry services as more households accrue wealth and become better able to afford estate planning. In 2021, household disposable income is anticipated to increase in line with overall economic growth, benefiting the industry.

FAQs.question: Number of deaths
FAQs.answer: When the number of deaths increases, demand for estate administration, probate and dispute resolution services increases, benefiting the industry. In 2020, the coronavirus pandemic led to a surge in deaths, benefiting the industry. In 2021, the death rate is expected to decrease, potentially hurting certain operators.
